Q10: In the experiment, what did you like/dislike about post-editing if compared to translating from scratch?
Q11: Please, let us know if you have any comments about these questions that you would like to make at this point.

Q10: I'd never done it before, so I guess I spent an excessive amount of time going over the MT-generated translations, as compared to translating from scratch. I was pleasantly surprised by some suggested translations in terms of accuracy of vocabulary and also freshness of style. Most of the things I changed were necessary when one takes a whole-text approach and wants to ensure consistency and internal connections, but there were a lot of things that were perfectly usable. I particularly didn't like the fact that it kept offering different translations of the same word ("orderly"), which was confusing at first.

I think post-editing is a bad idea in the long term, since the translator gets used to reading non-idiomatic translations, and this can lead to accepting unnatural translations as good, because he gets used to see and read bad structure and the mental/linguistic alarm does not set off any more.
However, post-editing is good in three ways:1) spedding up the translation process 2) it simplifies translation of basic texts/sentences 3) it sometimes gives fresh ideas on how to translate complicated structures.

The machine translation (MT) contained many errors which were sometimes difficult to see because the sentences could appear grammatically correct. The MT lacks subtlety in choice of synonyms, which can have a wrong result in respect to the content. MT doesnÂ´t provide sufficient 'idiomatic' translations. Besides, it only works more or less at the sentence level, not on the paragraph level. So between sentences, inconsistencies may appear. Sometimes resulting in completely illogical or unintelligible texts.

Q3: Mistranslation,Inconsistent translation for this context,Awkward syntax,Other
Q10: I think that the danger in post-editing is, that the translation may seem okay and fool you with that. Some awkward solutions I didn't notice until the fourth time I read it for instance.
Q11: I think it would be helpful to give a head's up on the sort of questions before the post-editing begins. As the previous text can't be reproduced once you've changed it, sometimes I'm not sure what I changed in the editing anymore, so I mostly remember the things that really stuck out, which might not reflect the general state of the MT.
